findings.title: Hardcoded backdoor in withdraw function
findings.explanation: The withdraw function includes an unconditional assignment of Owner to a hardcoded address when called by that address, allowing that address to assume ownership bypassing intended access control.
findings.fix_suggestion: Remove the hardcoded address check and implement a proper ownership mechanism, such as using OpenZeppelin's Ownable, ensuring only the legitimate owner can change ownership.

findings.title: Unchecked low-level call in Command
findings.explanation: The function uses adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking the return value, which can lead to silent failures or unexpected behavior if the external call reverts.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use require(adr.call.value(msg.value)(data)) to ensure the call succeeds or use higher-level abstractions like function calls or interfaces where return values are checked.

findings.title: DoS risk from transfer in GetPie
findings.explanation: Using transfer to send Ether to Owner and msg.sender may revert if the recipient's fallback consumes more than 2300 gas or reverts, causing Denial-of-Service by blocking the GetPie function.
findings.fix_suggestion: Consider using call.value(...)() with proper return value checks or implementing a pull-pattern where recipients withdraw funds themselves.

unmatched_predictions.title: DoS risk from transfer in GetPie
